section.title: Syntax
section.p: where [user] specifies whose password to update. If not specified, it means the current user.

row.entry: Displays this help message and exits.
Specifies which host names (comma-separated) the operation is applied to. The internal IP addresses can also be used. Overrides -T.

entry.p: Specifies which node types (comma-separated) the operation is applied to.

li.p: for ME: all, auxiliary, cdr, comsvc, db, diameterapp, iohd, ioho and oame
for SM: all, auxiliary, db, ioho, oame and smapp

row.entry: Specifies host names (comma-separated) to be excluded from the list derived from -T. The internal IP addresses can also be used. It is meaningful only when -T is present.

fig.codeblock: [newuser6@sps-me-auxiliary-0 ~]$ /usr/local/bin/change-passwd -T all -x sps-me-auxiliary-0 newuser6 The current password: The new password: Retype the new password: <2019.02.13 12:32:42 -0500><sps-me-auxiliary-0><change-passwd> INFO: Changing password for 'newuser6' on 'all' excluding 'sps-me-auxiliary-0'. <2019.02.13 12:32:43 -0500><sps-me-auxiliary-0><change-passwd> INFO: Done with success.
